meanings.definition: The quality or state of being pitiful.
meanings.sent1: Her pitifulness was evident in the way she looked downcast all the time.
meanings.sent2: The pitifulness of the abandoned puppy touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: Despite his pitifulness, he always managed to make us smile with his silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: The pitifulness of the situation was like a dark cloud hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The pitifulness of the old, abandoned house was hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.definition: The feeling of sorrow or compassion aroused by the suffering or misfortune of others.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but feel pitifulness for the homeless man on the street.
meanings.sent2: His eyes were filled with pitifulness as he listened to the heartbreaking story.
meanings.sent3: The pitifulness in her voice made it hard to ignore her plea for help.
meanings.sent4: The pitifulness in the air was palpable as they witnessed the aftermath of the disaster.
meanings.sent5: The pitifulness in her expression moved even the toughest of hearts.
